Authors: Qian Chen, Yu Cheng Dai, Xue Mei Tian
Title:
Three new species of Fuscoporia (Hymenochaetales,
Basidiomycota) from China
Abstract:
Three new Fuscoporia species, F. acutimarginata, F.
pulviniformis and F. ramulicola, are described from China based on
phylogenetic analysis and morphological characteristics. They have
annual to perennial, resupinate to effused-reflexed basidiocarps, a
dimitic hyphal system, encrustations on generative hyphae, the presence
of subulate hymenial setae originating from tramal hyphae, the presence
of cystidioles and hyaline, thin-walled and smooth basidiospores. The
individual morphological characters of the new species and their related
species are discussed. In the phylogenetic tree based on ITS + nLSU +
RPB2 datasets confirmed three new species were nested within the
Fuscoporia ferrea complex, and formed three well-supported lineages
distinct from other species. A key to Chinese species of Fuscoporia is
provided.
